Question: Don Larsen threw the first pitch to this person, to honor the perfect game from the 1956 World Series.
Hints: This person was excellent at hitting poor pitches, covering all areas of the strike zone (as well as beyond) with great extension.
This person appeared in fourteen World Series, winning ten championships, both of which are records.
Following a loss, infielder Phil Linz was playing his harmonica, and this person ordered him to stop.
